trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare"></xref> event.
You can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare> event to provide custom sorting.

This event occurs only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not set and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.VirtualMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `false`.
This event occurs once for each pair of cells in the column being sorted.

It occurs only when the user clicks the header of a column with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode.Automatic>, or when you call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%28System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn%2CSystem.ComponentModel.ListSortDirection%29?displayProperty=fullName> overload.

When this event occurs for a column with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode.Programmatic>, you must display the sorting glyph yourself through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.SortGlyphDirection%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
You can use this event to sort rows using the cell values in one column or in multiple columns.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue1%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue2%2A> properties to compare cell values in the column specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.Column%2A> property.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.RowIndex1%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.RowIndex2%2A> properties to access values in other columns through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Rows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs"></xref> class.
The column to sort.
The value of the first cell to compare.
The value of the second cell to compare.
The index of the row containing the first cell.
The index of the row containing the second cell.
Gets the value of the first cell to compare.
This property is typically used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue2%2A> property.
The value of the first cell.
Gets the value of the second cell to compare.
This property is typically used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue1%2A> property.
The value of the second cell.
Gets the column being sorted.
This property is useful in determining and controlling sort behavior in programmatic sorts.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn"></xref> to sort.
Gets the index of the row containing the first cell to compare.
This property is useful when sorting rows based on the cell values in multiple columns.
The index of the row containing the second cell.
Gets the index of the row containing the second cell to compare.
This property is useful when sorting rows based on the cell values in multiple columns.
The index of the row containing the second cell.
Gets or sets a value indicating the order in which the compared cells will be sorted.
Setting this value is typically the last operation you will perform in a handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare?displayProperty=fullName> event.
You will typically set this value to the return value of a comparison method such as <xref:System.String.Compare%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Less than zero if the first cell will be sorted before the second cell; zero if the first cell and second cell have equivalent values; greater than zero if the second cell will be sorted before the first cell.
